snippet: Flexible planning helps retailers keep merchandise on the shelves in the event a disruption in the supply chain affects a major market.
abstract: Major storms like Hurricane Sandy and other unexpected events have prompted some companies to modify the popular just-in-time style of doing business, in which only small amounts of inventory are kept on hand, to fashion what is known as just-in-case management; flexible planning and adding distribution hubs allow retailers to keep merchandise on shelves in the event of supply chain disruptions.
lead_paragraph: Flexible planning helps retailers keep merchandise on the shelves in the event a disruption in the supply chain affects a major market.

headline.seo: New Hubs Arise to Serve a ‘Just in Case’ Supply Chain
headline.main: New Hubs Arise to Serve ‘Just in Case’ Distribution
headline.print_headline: New Hubs Arise to Serve ‘Just in Case’ Distribution
